title: DOA-journal-occupational
text:
This is a project proposal for a diamond open access (DOA) journal in occupational health, with a focus on the publication of research and educational content, as well as experiences from young researchers in the field. As an academic and community-led journal, content will be published online-only, at no cost to authors and readers, whilst allowing authors to retain copyright of their work.
To learn more about the diamond open access (DOA) publication model, please refer to https://www.coalition-s.org/diamond-open-access/.

title: DOA-journal-occupational
text:
Types of content
The journal will publish the following types of content:

Research articles: Original research articles that present new findings in the field of occupational health. These articles will be peer-reviewed by experts in the field.
Review articles: Comprehensive reviews of current topics in occupational health, including systematic reviews and meta-analyses.
Narrative reviews: Articles that provide a narrative overview of a specific topic in occupational health, without the need for a systematic review.
Protocols: Detailed descriptions of research protocols for studies in occupational health.
Tutorials: Articles that provide step-by-step instructions on how to perform specific techniques and/or analyses, with emphasis in open science practices.
Dataset: Description of a dataset with the potential to be reused by other practitioners and researchers in the occupational health field.
Software: Description of software tools or applications that can be used by practitioners and researchers in the occupational health field.
Commentaries: Opinion pieces or perspectives on current issues in occupational health.
Case studies: Reports of unique cases or experiences in the field of occupational health.
Editorial: Editorial content from the journal’s editorial board, including updates on the journal’s policies and practices.
